meanings.definition: The negative response or refusal to something.
meanings.sent1: She shook her head in noes when asked to stay late at work.
meanings.sent2: His constant noes to any new ideas made it difficult to progress.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a series of noes by knocking over the plant when told not to climb it.
meanings.sent4: The storm of noes from the audience made the speaker reconsider his approach.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's noes were firm but fair, guiding the students towards better choices.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'no'.
meanings.sent1: Their noes echoed in the empty room, a chorus of disagreement.
meanings.sent2: The noes on the ballots outnumbered the yes votes.
meanings.sent3: The noes on the sign-up sheet indicated a lack of interest in the event.
meanings.sent4: The noes in the room grew louder as the discussion continued.
meanings.sent5: The noes of the group were heard loud and clear, signaling a united front.
